# Stale

After discussing in [this thread](%wQSY4HaJoWBul2tmOwhLgVzVxJdM6K1pudsu5aElS9M=.sha256) I've opened a [pull request into secure-scuttlebutt](https://github.com/ssbc/secure-scuttlebutt/pull/230) and enabled the [Stale app](https://github.com/probot/stale) in *only* the secure-scuttlebutt repository. The current behavior is simple:

- Threads with no activity for 60 days will be marked as stale.
- A comment will be posted saying ~"this is stale and will be closed in 7 days unless there's activity"
- If 7 days pass without any activity, the issue/PR will be closed.

I don't think closing stale issues is controversial, but the onslaught of emails isn't my favorite. I like to tinker, so I'm tempted to immediately start trying different settings, but for the sake of science I'm going to leave the defaults for at least a week and see where the pain points are. **This thread should serve as a forum to discuss, complain, and navel-gaze about stale issues.**

My first instinct is to disable the warning comment, so that we only get the email about how the issue is closed, but it seems a bit impolite. Maybe a closing comment would be more appropriate? The [configuration file](https://github.com/ssbc/secure-scuttlebutt/blob/master/.github/stale.yml) is pretty simple, so it should be easy to make any changes that we'd like.

**In case of emergency:** if the bot goes rogue and/or becomes sentient, it can easily be disabled in the [GitHub settings for the org](https://github.com/organizations/ssbc/settings/installations/407234). I don't have any reason to be concerned, but I like having a high [bus factor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bus_factor).
